page.title: 11The Stockton Cycle Route
page.content: The Stockton Cycle Route is a continuous three mile long route for pedestrians and cyclists,linking Bishopsgarth,Hardwick,Fairfield and Grangefield with Stockton Town Centre. It has been introduced to provide safe and pleasant conditions for cycling to school,shops and work or for leisure. A number of special facilities have been provided along the route.The Stockton cycle route is particularly significant since it is part of the Department of Transport's cycle route programme .This consists of a number of projects in various parts of the country which will be used to study the effect on cycle usage of providing major cycle routes in towns and cities.
